definition: to announce sb's demise/to predict death
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
mourning/funeral/(old) corpse

sentences.english: It is superstition that crows can predict death.
sentences.chinese: 乌鸦报丧是一种迷信的说法。

sentences.english: Give obituary notice it when some unfilial shall kneel down in front of a longer period of time crying.
sentences.chinese: 故有些不孝子报丧时须在舅家门口下跪痛哭较长时间。

sentences.english: Press the truth, home someone died, should choose a lucky day report to lose.
sentences.chinese: 按道理，家里有人去世了，是应该选吉日报丧的。

definition: to visit the bereaved to offer one's condolences
a condolence visit
to hold a funeral procession
to hold a funeral
funeral arrangements
to hasten home for the funeral of a parent or grandparent
to participate in funeral procession/to attend a burial
to attend a funeral/to take part in a funeral procession
a worship ceremony for the dead/to offer sacrifice (to ancestors)/a libation
funeral/funeral procession
to wear mourning garb/to be in mourning
to keep watch beside a coffin
to wear mourning clothes/to be in mourning/also written 披麻帶孝|披麻带孝
variant of 戴孝[dai4 xiao4]
funeral
to take a letter/to send word
